1/n. Winter floods temporarily fill the stunning outer & inner #moats of Earith Bulwark, Cambs. Designed to be permanently water-filled, the moats have gradually silted up but almost every winter the 17thC landscape is briefly restored.

Built in about 1643, it was one of the most elaborate #CivilWar #forts, with its square inner enclosure, corner bastions, perimeter defences & outworks.

NB There's no public access, alas.

title: Residents in Chicago, Illinois are Reclaiming Vacant Properties

last_post.content:
"For over a year now, [people in Chicago] have been reclaiming vacant properties owned by the Chicago Housing Authority. The city and its private contractors abandoned thousands of units of so-called public housing. They let the pipes burst and the walls mold over, just so they can call them uninhabitable, schedule them for demolition, and sell the lots to the highest bidder.

NO MORE. We are inhabiting the uninhabitable. We have dumpstered our homes.

The houses, many of which were sitting empty for years, have become FREE SPACES that hold so much more than a roof over our heads. They are home to anarchist libraries, food distros, parties, film screenings, dinners, constantly re-arranging affinities, intimacies, and an endless tide of batshit ideas and inciteful possibilities."

#Chicago #Illinois #Housing #HousingCrisis

Marion Walter was born in 1928 to a Jewish family in Berlin.

In 1939, she escaped Nazi Germany on a Kindertransport - a rescue operation that evacuated thousands of Jewish children to England before World War II.

Eventually Marion arrived in the US & earned her doctorate in mathematics education from Harvard. She became a professor & founded the Boston Area Mathematics Specialists focused on improving math education for children.

Marion passed away in 2021, at age 92. https://mathshistory.st-andrews.ac.uk/Biographies/Walter/

From 2006/7, these 2 beautiful live-coded #GenerativeMusic pieces by Andrew Sorensen have been very inspirational to me. His work on Impromptu (later Extempore) was one of the reasons I became very interested in functional programming & Lisp (Clojure) back in 2010...

Study in Keith:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bq-260NUw5o&t=113s

Stained:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9TIaMRis8J0&t=63s

Both with slow, but epic build ups over 10-15 mins...

Somewhat related observation & question from #genuary2023 contribs to that topic: Even with more tools/langs available now, is interesting generative/coded music generally still a lot harder to pull off for people (i.e. there were much fewer submissions for that topic yesterday), since - even if going fully experimental and ignoring traditions - it somewhat does rely much more on temporal patterns & layers and interactions between those, and an at least basic music-theoretical background? My personal view & experience is that (as a medium) it's much more emotionally rewarding, but also much less forgiving than its visual counterpart if that background is lacking (and that is just the composition side, not even mentioning DSP aspects)...

(Btw. I'm looking at all this from a tool maker POV...)

If you want to give this a spin, you could do:

source("https://gist.githubusercontent.com/wviechtb/a5e0c0acea15073ceada80983bc904b5/raw/d53c9c5d33116cdd9bb2abac778c3acf99727ce5/journal_generator.r")

replicate(100, genjournal())

Works beautifully! You may expect an email soon from the "Open Journal of Child & Adolescent Mental Disorders and Medical Investigations".

title: CircleCI incident report for January 4, 2023 security incident

last_post.content:
CircleCI published an incident report on their recent breach, and it's super interesting! https://circleci.com/blog/jan-4-2023-incident-report/

The attacker avoided 2FA by infecting a user's machine, waiting for them to auth, and then just copying their session cookie to another computer where they could use it with no local monitoring. Either of two things could have prevented this:

1) Access to sensitive resources could be restricted to trusted machines
2) The cookie could have been tied to a hardware key on the machine

Once, a choleric widow lived in Much with her young children. When the children made a huge ruckus one morning, she told them:

"I wished that you and the house would be swallowed up by the ground before I returned from the spring!"

When she had come back with the water, she saw that only the rooftop of the house was still visible, and heard the children crying within. In her desperation, she jumped on the roof - and was swallowed as well.

title: Construction to start on bridge to be suspended over landslide site in Denali National Park - Alaska Beacon

last_post.content: In Alaska and elsewhere in the far north, a lot of slopes are held together by frozen material -- permafrost, glaciers, etc. Warming is causing those slopes to collapse. One of the most famous cases is in Denali, where the midpoint of park road has been closed because it's too dangerous to travel. Now a fix is on the way - a major construction project. #Alaska #climatechange #Denali #permafrost https://alaskabeacon.com/2023/01/13/construction-to-start-on-bridge-to-be-suspended-over-landslide-site-in-denali-national-park/
